item.title: End-to-end Development of Texas Inventionworks' Service Application
item.description: Please Note: Some details of this project have been censored to honor confidentiality! ðŸ“Œ Project Scope Client: Texas Inventionworks Timeline: Full-time, 3 months My Role: Lead-UX Researcher, Lead-UX Designer, Lead-UX Engineer Team: 2-3 student student staff members Methods: User Personas, User Flows, Wireframes, Rapid Prototyping Tools: Figma, Agile Scrum, AWS, React ðŸ§ Background During the summer of 2020, I co-led the development of a website to automate and digitize the operational workflow of Texas Inventionworks (TIW) (The University of Texas at Austin’s engineering school’s Makerspace).

item.title: Employee Experience Research for a Rapidly Scaling Organization
item.description: Background In the ever-evolving landscape of innovation, Texas Inventionworks (TIW) stands as the epitome of a pioneering force in engineering and education at The University of Texas at Austin. As a dynamic “skunk works” initiative, TIW redefines the conventional engineering education paradigm. From its modest roots in a 1,700-square-foot lab, TIW has burgeoned into a multifaceted program. The expansion into the EER marked a pivotal moment, propelling TIW into exponential growth across technology, community outreach, and an expanding workforce.
